timeline.bodyText: Minor: executionException -> ExecutionException. We don't necessarily need to address in this PR, but I'm wondering if we should be using @link for such references.
timeline.author: fpj

timeline.bodyText:
Haven't you used ledgers path + zkPort before? Should we use the same here? This is what I'm thinking about:
https://github.com/pravega/pravega/pull/4999/files#diff-7cb38ef4f69c054db7f40fc17995e399cfbc2c96cc35ec1e5d40a969e3bb3aedR62

PR feedback

Signed-off-by: Tom Kaitchuck <tom.kaitchuck@emc.com>
Merge branch 'faster-build' of github.com:tkaitchuck/pravega-1 into faster-build

timeline.bodyText: why are we removing this.. this is a zookeeper node which needs to be cleaned up.
timeline.author: shiveshr

timeline.bodyText: why not remove the reader from inside cell.stop which terminates the reader and only after that we remove it. here we could be removing it prematurely.
timeline.author: shiveshr

replies.bodyText:
it would make a difference if we are unable to do a clean shutdown (where we use the last reader position and report it offline at that position..
say all of that failed but we removed the reader postion from zookeeper, then another controller will not be able to correctly failover this reader.
replies.author: shiveshr

replies.bodyText:
While I agree it would be cleaner, my motivation for not doing it inside the cell, is because it causes problems on shutdown.
Specifically if the checkpointStore needs to be written to, then every cell will need to timeout writing to it. As there are many cells this results in very long delays in the tests. In fact it is the largest single contributor of integration test time.
I have addressed the concern raised here about this being too soon by moving it after the await.
replies.author: tkaitchuck

timeline.bodyText: thank you :)
timeline.author: shiveshr

timeline.bodyText:
Is the reason for this change related to the below WARN message observed on Segment store ?
2021-02-26 05:38:20,547 13644 [core-1] WARN  o.a.b.client.BookieWatcherImpl - New ensemble: [nautilus-bookie-2.nautilus-bookie-headless.nautilus-pravega.svc.cluster.local:3181, nautilus-bookie-0.nautilus-bookie-headless.nautilus-pravega.svc.cluster.local:3181, nautilus-bookie-1.nautilus-bookie-headless.nautilus-pravega.svc.cluster.local:3181] is not adhering to Placement Policy. quarantinedBookies: []

timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -50,8 +52,9 @@ public GRPCServer(ControllerService controllerService, GRPCServerConfig serverCo
         this.config = serverConfig;
         GrpcAuthHelper authHelper = new GrpcAuthHelper(serverConfig.isAuthorizationEnabled(),
                 serverConfig.getTokenSigningKey(), serverConfig.getAccessTokenTTLInSeconds());
-        ServerBuilder<?> builder = ServerBuilder
+        ServerBuilder<?> builder = NettyServerBuilder
                 .forPort(serverConfig.getPort())
+                .withChildOption(ChannelOption.SO_REUSEADDR, true)

timeline.bodyText: Was this the source of that cyclical reference we saw every now and then in logs?
timeline.author: andreipaduroiu

replies.bodyText:
When I was debugging some of the tests this error path caused a ref cycle which would in a different part of the code caused a OutOfStackSpace error because it sent error message processing into an infinite loop.
I am not aware of this having been encountered anywhere else.
replies.author: tkaitchuck

timeline.bodyText: Let's use config.getWriteTimeout().seconds() for this. At least we'll have a way to configure it in case we need to.
timeline.author: andreipaduroiu
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -78,20 +83,21 @@
      */
     static WriteHandle create(BookKeeper bookKeeper, BookKeeperConfig config, int logId) throws DurableDataLogException {
         try {
-
-            return Exceptions.handleInterruptedCall(() ->
-                    FutureUtils.result(bookKeeper.newCreateLedgerOp()
-                            .withEnsembleSize(config.getBkEnsembleSize())
-                            .withWriteQuorumSize(config.getBkWriteQuorumSize())
-                            .withAckQuorumSize(config.getBkAckQuorumSize())
-                            .withDigestType(config.getDigestType())
-                            .withPassword(config.getBKPassword())
-                            .withCustomMetadata(createLedgerCustomMetadata(logId))
-                            .execute(), BK_EXCEPTION_HANDLER) );
+            CompletableFuture<WriteHandle> future = bookKeeper.newCreateLedgerOp()
+                .withEnsembleSize(config.getBkEnsembleSize())
+                .withWriteQuorumSize(config.getBkWriteQuorumSize())
+                .withAckQuorumSize(config.getBkAckQuorumSize())
+                .withDigestType(config.getDigestType())
+                .withPassword(config.getBKPassword())
+                .withCustomMetadata(createLedgerCustomMetadata(logId))
+                .execute();
+            return Futures.getAndHandleExceptions(future, BK_EXCEPTION_HANDLER, 20, TimeUnit.SECONDS);

timeline.bodyText: Are we using rack awareness in the tests?

         String id = Integer.toString(instanceId);
         return configBuilder
                 .makeCopy()
+                .include(BookKeeperConfig.builder().with(BookKeeperConfig.BK_ENFORCE_MIN_NUM_RACKS_PER_WRITE, false)

timeline.bodyText: This is setting a global timeout of two minutes, that's a lot, no?
timeline.author: fpj

timeline.bodyText: This is also setting to two minutes, is it necessary to make it that long?
timeline.author: fpj
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -262,7 +263,7 @@ public void testSegmentRestoration() throws Exception {
      *
      * @throws Exception If an exception occurred.
      */
-    @Test
+    @Test(timeout = 120000)

timeline.bodyText: This change seems unnecessary, what's the reason for this change?
timeline.author: fpj

replies.bodyText: InetAddress.getLoopbackAddress() can return the IPv6 address, and appears to do so at random. When it does and the binding is on IPv4, this results in connection failures. I observe this locally but have never seen it on Travis or Github Actions.
replies.author: tkaitchuck

replies.bodyText: Instead of hardwiring 127.0.0.1, could we instead say use java.net.preferIPv4Stack for tests?
replies.author: fpj

timeline.bodyText: Minor: remove leading white spaces. Shouldn't our checkstyle be complaining about these things?
timeline.author: fpj

replies.bodyText: Checkstyle only considers trailing whitespace a problem on lines with stuff on them. Lines that are all whitespace are permitted.
replies.author: tkaitchuck

timeline.bodyText: It sounds like checkstyle is missing this rule.
timeline.author: fpj

timeline.bodyText: Are you following any guidelines for test timeouts or are you determining it based on test failure observations?
timeline.author: fpj
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -24,7 +24,7 @@
  */
 public class SingleThreadEndToEndTest {
 
-    @Test(timeout = 30000)
+    @Test(timeout = 60000)

timeline.bodyText: For completeness, why did you have to write this class and what's that RunNotifier?
timeline.author: fpj

replies.bodyText:
Added a Javadoc.
It's needed for some metrics tests which cannot be run in parallel.
RunNotifier is a Junit class. It's not really being used here except as a pass-through to the parent implementation.
replies.author: tkaitchuck
